alert.note: Alert for Kauai East; Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued January 10 at 4:00PM HST until January 13 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY CANCELLED FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI AND OAHU... ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY MORNING FOR ALL HAWAIIAN ISLANDS... .Moderate to large northwest swell (310-320 degree) has declined below advisory levels. Winter peak high tides during the early morning hours 3 am and 4 am HST will produce minor coastal flooding early Thursday morning. A large north swell will cause additional wave run-up coinciding with peak high tides early Friday and Saturday morning that will generate moderate coastal flooding. ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH 6 AM HST SATURDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Isolated minor coastal flooding expected. Moderate coastal flooding Friday and Saturday. * WHERE...Niihau, Kauai Southwest, Waianae Coast, Oahu North Shore, Kauai North and Kauai East. * WHEN...Through 6 AM HST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of beaches that are normally dry, minor coastal erosion, and saltwater inundation. Submit your coastal flooding photos to the University of Hawaii Sea Grant College Program`s Hawaii and Pacific Islands King Tides Project at: PacificIslandsKingTides.org
info.instruction: Avoid driving through flooded roadways. If you are forced to drive through salt water, be sure to rinse your vehicle with fresh water. Move electronics, vehicles or other valuables to higher ground. Monitor vessels to ensure mooring lines don`t get too tight and watch out for overwash around boat ramps. Secure canoes or other watercraft stowed on beaches.

area.areaDesc: Kauai East; Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast
